com.sybil_ehrensberger.transvis

Class Transcript

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sybil_ehrensberger.transvis.Transcript

  • public class Transcript
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for each transcript and thus each individual process.
    Author:
    Sybil Ehrensberger

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String n)
             throws TranscriptParseError
        Parse the name attribute of the document in to individual parts and throw a fatal error if is malformed.
        Parameters:
        n - the name attribute from the XML file
        Throws:
        TranscriptParseError - if the transcript is invalid

      • addRecording

        public void addRecording(Recording r)
                  throws TranscriptParseError
        Add the recording information to the transcript and validate it. If it is not valid, throw a fatal error.
        Parameters:
        r - the recording information to be added
        Throws:
        TranscriptParseError - if the transcript is invalid

      • error

        public void error(java.lang.String s)

      • setSelection

        public void setSelection(int type,
                         int start,
                         int end)
        Set the selection according to the given type and given start and end times. Filter the incidents accordingly so only incidents within that time span will be used.
        Parameters:
        type - number indicating which type was chosen in the GUI (0: partial, 1: complete, 2: orientation, 3: drafting, 4: revision)
        start - the start time in seconds for partial processes
        end - the end time in seconds for partial processes

      • adjustTimesToSelection

        public void adjustTimesToSelection(boolean adjust)
        Adjust the times of each incident to the current selection. Only adjust if the boolean adjust is true.

        Function to be used in the graphs so that an incident a the start of a phase (orientation, drafting, revision) will always have start time 0. This way, processes with different phase lengths can be compared accurately. Beware this function adjusts the times in place (i.e. each incident is modified).

        Parameters:
        adjust - whether to adjust the times or not

      • adjustTime

        public int adjustTime(java.lang.String timestring)
        Converts a time (String) of the format HH:MM:SS to seconds and adjusts it to the adjustment start time.
        Parameters:
        timestring - a String representing a time (HH:MM:SS)
        Returns:
        an int representing the time in seconds

      • adjustTime

        public int adjustTime(int t)
        Adjust the given time t to ignore the warm-up phase.
        Parameters:
        t - the time in seconds
        Returns:
        the adjusted time in seconds
